sen.j: 宮内庁（くないちょう、英訳名Imperial Household Agency）は、日本の行政機関の一つ。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency is one of the administrative agencies in Japan.
The Imperial Household Agency (called Kunai-cho in Japanese) is one of the administrative agencies in Japan.
sen.cmt: 誤訳等ではございません。ただ、「くないちょう」と日本語で呼ばれていることを示唆する言葉を入れておいたようがよいかもしれないと思い、追加してみました。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency (called Kunai-cho in Japanese) is one of the administrative agencies in Japan.

sen.j: 皇室関係の国家事務、天皇の国事行為にあたる外国の大使・公使の接受に関する事務、皇室の儀式に係る事務をつかさどり、御璽・国璽を保管する。
sen.e: This agency handles the routine functions of national affairs, office work of receiving of foreign ambassadors and ministers as an emperor's constitutional functions, affairs on Imperial family's ceremonies, and stores the gyoji (the imperial Seal) and the seal of state.

This agency handles the routine functions of national affairs, office work of receiving of foreign ambassadors and ministers as an emperor's constitutional functions, affairs on Imperial family's ceremonies, and stores the gyoji (the imperial Seal) and the seal of state.

This agency handles the routine functions of national affairs, office work of receiving of foreign ambassadors and ministers as an emperor's constitutional functions, affairs on Imperial family's ceremonies, and stores the gyoji (the imperial Seal) and the seal of state.

sen.j: 宮内庁は、天皇に近侍した古代からの官職をその淵源とする。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency originates from the ancient government post to serve the Emperor.
The Imperial Household Agency originates from the ancient government post to serve the Emperor.
The Imperial Household Agency originates from the ancient government post to serve the Emperor.

sen.j: 日本最古の歴史書とされる『日本書紀』の天武天皇9年（680年）の条には「宮内卿」「宮内官大夫」の官職が記述され、686年（朱鳥元年）の条には天武天皇の葬送に際して「宮内事」を誄（しのびごと）したとあり、天武天皇の時代には原型となる官職が形成されたと見られる。
sen.e: In the article of Emperor Temmu in 680 of the oldest history book in Japan, "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), there was a description on the government posts of Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) and Miyanouchi no tsukasa no kami and also in the article of in 686, there was another description on Emperor Temmu's funeral that shinobigoto (speech given to the spirit of the departed about his/her merit) was conducted for the "miyanouchi-no-koto" (Imperial family's affairs), from which the original government post was established in the period of Emperor Temmu.
sen.cmt: 用語集では「宮内事」の読みも訳も不明となっています。調べましたが読み方も訳も見つかりませんでしたので、miyanouchi-no-koto (Imperial family's affairs) としておきます。
sen.e: In the article of Emperor Temmu in 680 of the oldest history book in Japan, "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), there was a description on the government posts of Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) and Miyanouchi no tsukasa no kami and also in the article of in 686, there was another description on Emperor Temmu's funeral that shinobigoto (speech given to the spirit of the departed about his/her merit) was conducted for the "miyanouchi-no-koto" (Imperial family's affairs), from which the original government post was established in the period of Emperor Temmu.

In the article of Emperor Temmu in 680 of the oldest history book in Japan, "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), there was a description on the government posts of Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) and Miyanouchi no tsukasa no kami and also in the article of in 686, there was another description on Emperor Temmu's funeral that shinobigoto (speech given to the spirit of the departed about his/her merit) was conducted for the "miyanouchi-no-koto" (Imperial family's affairs), from which the original government post was established in the period of Emperor Temmu.

sen.j: その後、701年（大宝 (日本)元年）に定められた大宝令官制に至って、後の八省の一つとなる宮内省（くないしょう、みやのうちのつかさ）に類似した組織が定められたとされる。
sen.e: Later, it is said that, according to the regulations based on Taiho-ryo (Taiho Code) set in 701, an organization similar to the Imperial Household Ministry (kunai-sho, miyanouchi-no-tsukasa) which became one of the Hassho (eight ministries and agencies) was established.

Later, it is said that, according to the regulations based on Taiho-ryo (Taiho Code) set in 701, an organization similar to the Imperial Household Ministry (kunai-sho, miyanouchi-no-tsukasa) which became one of the Hassho (eight ministries and agencies) was established.

Later, it is said that, according to the regulations based on Taiho-ryo (Taiho Code) set in 701, an organization similar to the Imperial Household Ministry (kunai-sho, miyanouchi-no-tsukasa) which became one of the Hassho (eight ministries and agencies) was established.

sen.j: 明治維新後の1869年（明治2年）には、古代の太政官制に倣い、宮内省が組織され、その長官として宮内卿が置かれた。
sen.e: In 1869 after the Meiji Restoration, the Imperial Household Ministry was organized modeled after ancient Dajokan (Great Council of State) System and Kunaikyo was appointed as the Grand Steward of the Ministry.

In 1869 after the Meiji Restoration, the Imperial Household Ministry was organized modeled after ancient Dajokan (Great Council of State) System and Kunaikyo was appointed as the Grand Steward of the Ministry.

In 1869 after the Meiji Restoration, the Imperial Household Ministry was organized modeled after ancient Dajokan (Great Council of State) System and Kunaikyo was appointed as the Grand Steward of the Ministry.

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年）に内閣制度が創設される際には、従来の宮内卿に替わって宮内大臣が置かれたが、「宮中府中の別」の原則に従って、宮内大臣は内閣の一員とされなかった。
sen.e: When the cabinet system was set up in 1885, the Imperial Household Minister was established replaced existing Kunaikyo, but the minister was not included in cabinet members following the principle of "distinction between Imperial court and government offices."

When the cabinet system was set up in 1885, the Imperial Household Minister was established replaced existing Kunaikyo, but the minister was not included in cabinet members following the principle of "distinction between Imperial court and government offices."

When the cabinet system was set up in 1885, the Imperial Household Minister was established replaced existing Kunaikyo, but the minister was not included in cabinet members following the principle of "distinction between Imperial court and government offices."

sen.j: このとき、内大臣、宮中顧問官などの官職も置かれた。
sen.e: At this time, the government posts such as the Minister of the Palace and the imperial court councilor were also established..
At this time, the government posts such as the Minister of the Palace and the imperial court councilor were also established.
sen.cmt: 文末のピリオドが２つあったので、１つ削除しました。
sen.e: At this time, the government posts such as the Minister of the Palace and the imperial court councilor were also established.

sen.j: 1886年（明治19年）には宮内省官制が定められ、2課5職6寮4局の組織が定まった。
sen.e: In 1886, regulations for Ministry of the Imperial Household were established and the organization of two sections, five shiki (office), six bureaus, and four departments was set up.
sen.cmt: 課、職、寮、局の定訳が分かりませんでした。用語集にも記載がありません。
sen.e: In 1886, regulations for Ministry of the Imperial Household were established and the organization of two sections, five offices (shiki), six bureaus, and four departments was set up.
sen.cmt: five shiki (office) を five offices (shiki) に入れ替えました。
sen.e: In 1886, regulations for Ministry of the Imperial Household were established and the organization of two sections, five offices (shiki), six bureaus, and four departments was set up.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）には、大日本帝国憲法の公布とともに、旧皇室典範が裁定され、皇室自律の原則が確立した。
sen.e: In 1889, Former Imperial House Act was established when the Constitution of the Empire of Japan was proclaimed, and the principle of autonomy of the Imperial Household was established.
In 1889, Former Imperial House Act was established when the Constitution of the Empire of Japan was proclaimed, and the principle of autonomy of the Imperial Household was established.
In 1889, Former Imperial House Act was established when the Constitution of the Empire of Japan was proclaimed, and the principle of autonomy of the Imperial Household was established.

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）には、皇室令による宮内省官制が施行され、宮内大臣は皇室一切の事務につき天皇を輔弼する機関とされた。
sen.e: In 1908, regulations for Ministry of the Imperial Household came into force based on Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) and the Imperial Household Minister was set up as an agency to hohitsu (to make advices to the Emperor with full responsibility of the results) all the Imperial Household affairs.

In 1908, regulations for Ministry of the Imperial Household came into force based on Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) and the Imperial Household Minister was set up as an agency to make advices to the Emperor with full responsibility of the results (hohitsu) all the Imperial Household affairs.
sen.cmt: agency to hohitsu (to make advices to the Emperor with full responsibility of the results) を agency to make advices to the Emperor with full responsibility of the results (hohitsu) に入れ替えました。
sen.e: In 1908, regulations for Ministry of the Imperial Household came into force based on Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) and the Imperial Household Minister was set up as an agency to make advices to the Emperor with full responsibility of the results (hohitsu) all the Imperial Household affairs.

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年）の終戦の際には、宮内省は、1官房2職8寮2局のほか、内大臣府、掌典職、御歌所、帝室博物館、帝室林野局、学習院など13の外局と京都事務所を持ち、職員6,200人余を擁する大きな組織となっていた。
sen.e: In 1945, at the end of the war, the Imperial Household Ministry had became a big organization with 13 extra-ministerial bureaus such as Naidaijin-fu (Minister of Interior's Office), ceremonial staff, Outadokoro (Imperial Poetry Bureau), Imperial Household Museum, Imperial Forestry Bureau, and The Gakushuin School Corporation, and Imperial Household Agency Kyoto Office as well as one Secretariat, two shiki, eight bureaus, and two departments, and had more than 6.200 employees.
sen.cmt: 掌典職の訳は用語集で「ceremonial staff」となっています。ここで言っているのは部局名ではないかと思うのですが、用語集どおりにしておきます。
sen.e: In 1945, at the end of the war, the Imperial Household Ministry had became a big organization with 13 extra-ministerial bureaus such as Naidaijin-fu (Minister of Interior's Office), ceremonial staff, Outadokoro (Imperial Poetry Bureau), Imperial Household Museum, Imperial Forestry Bureau, and The Gakushuin School Corporation, and Imperial Household Agency Kyoto Office as well as one Secretariat, two offices, eight bureaus, and two departments, and had more than 6.200 employees.
sen.cmt: 上記の文章と揃うように、shiki を offices に変えました。
sen.e: In 1945, at the end of the war, the Imperial Household Ministry had became a big organization with 13 extra-ministerial bureaus such as Naidaijin-fu (Minister of Interior's Office), ceremonial staff, Outadokoro (Imperial Poetry Bureau), Imperial Household Museum, Imperial Forestry Bureau, and The Gakushuin School Corporation, and Imperial Household Agency Kyoto Office as well as one Secretariat, two offices, eight bureaus, and two departments, and had more than 6.200 employees.

sen.j: その後、宮内省の事務を他の政府機関に移管もしくは分離独立して機構の縮小を図り、1947年（昭和22年）5月3日の日本国憲法施行とともに、宮内省から宮内府となり、内閣総理大臣の所轄する機関となった。
sen.e: After that, the agency slimed down its organization by transferring its office routine work of the Imperial Household Agency to other government agencies or separating some work from the agency, and changed from the Imperial Household Ministry to Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency), and became one of agencies under the prime minister.

After that, the agency slimed down its organization by transferring its office routine work of the Imperial Household Agency to other government agencies or separating some work from the agency, and changed from the Imperial Household Ministry to Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency) along with the enforcement of the Constitution of Japan on May 3, 1947, and became one of agencies under the prime minister.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ「1947年（昭和22年）5月3日の日本国憲法施行とともに、」の部分の訳漏れを補いました。
sen.e: After that, the agency slimed down its organization by transferring its office routine work of the Imperial Household Agency to other government agencies or separating some work from the agency, and changed from the Imperial Household Ministry to Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency) along with the enforcement of the Constitution of Japan on May 3, 1947, and became one of agencies under the prime minister.

sen.j: 宮内府は、宮内府長官の下、1官房3職3寮と京都事務所が置かれ、職員数も1,500人弱となった。
sen.e: Kunaifu had one Secretariat, three shiki, three bureaus and Kyoto Office under the Grand Steward of Kunaifu, and the number of employees was reduced to a little under 1,500.
Kunaifu had one Secretariat, three offices, three bureaus and Kyoto Office under the Grand Steward of Kunaifu, and the number of employees was reduced to a little under 1,500.
sen.cmt: 上記の文章と揃うように、shiki を offices に変えました。
sen.e: Kunaifu had one Secretariat, three offices, three bureaus and Kyoto Office under the Grand Steward of Kunaifu, and the number of employees was reduced to a little under 1,500.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）6月1日には、総理府設置法の施行により、宮内府は宮内庁となって総理府の外局となり、宮内庁長官の下に宮内庁次長が置かれ、1官房3職2部と京都事務所が設置された。
sen.e: On June 1st, 1949, as a result of enforcement of the General Administrative Agency of the Cabinet Establishment Act, Kunaifu was changed to Kunai-cho, the Imperial Household Agency, and became an extra-ministerial bureau of the Prime Minister's Office, and the post of the deputy director of Imperial Household Agency was set under the Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency, and one Secretariat, three shiki, two departments, and Kyoto Office were set up.

On June 1st, 1949, as a result of enforcement of the General Administrative Agency of the Cabinet Establishment Act, Kunaifu was changed to Kunai-cho, the Imperial Household Agency, and became an extra-ministerial bureau of the Prime Minister's Office, and the post of the deputy director of Imperial Household Agency was set under the Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency, and one Secretariat, three offices, two departments, and Kyoto Office were set up.
sen.cmt: 上記の文章と揃うように、shiki を offices に変えました。
sen.e: On June 1st, 1949, as a result of enforcement of the General Administrative Agency of the Cabinet Establishment Act, Kunaifu was changed to Kunai-cho, the Imperial Household Agency, and became an extra-ministerial bureau of the Prime Minister's Office, and the post of the deputy director of Imperial Household Agency was set under the Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency, and one Secretariat, three offices, two departments, and Kyoto Office were set up.

sen.j: 2001年（平成13年）1月6日には、中央省庁等改革の一環として内閣府設置法が施行され、宮内庁は内閣府に置かれた。
sen.e: On January 1st, 2001, Cabinet Office Establishment Act came into force as part of the reform of central government ministries and agencies and the Imperial Household Agency was incorporated into the Cabinet Office.

On January 6, 2001, Cabinet Office Establishment Act came into force as part of the reform of central government ministries and agencies and the Imperial Household Agency was incorporated into the Cabinet Office.
sen.cmt: January 1st を January 6 に修正しました。
sen.e: On January 6, 2001, Cabinet Office Establishment Act came into force as part of the reform of central government ministries and agencies and the Imperial Household Agency was incorporated into the Cabinet Office.

sen.j: 宮内庁庁舎は、1935年（昭和10年）に建設された。
sen.e: The office building of the Imperial Household Agency was built in 1935.
The office building of the Imperial Household Agency was built in 1935.
The office building of the Imperial Household Agency was built in 1935.

sen.j: 「宮内庁」の表札等はない。
sen.e: The building has no name plate of "Imperial Household Agency."
The building has no name plate of "Imperial Household Agency."
The building has no name plate of "Imperial Household Agency."

sen.j: 明治宮殿が焼失してから今の宮殿が建設されるまでの間仮宮殿として用いられた。
sen.e: It was used as a temporal palace until the present palace was built after the Meiji Kyuden Imperial Palace was destroyed in a fire.
It was used as a temporal palace until the present palace was built after the Meiji Kyuden Imperial Palace was destroyed in a fire.
It was used as a temporal palace until the present palace was built after the Meiji Kyuden Imperial Palace was destroyed in a fire.

sen.j: 所在地：東京都千代田区千代田1番1（皇居内・坂下門の北側）なお、皇居全体が「千代田区千代田」である。
sen.e: Address: 1-1 Chiyoda, Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo Metropolis (in the Imperial Palace, north of Sakashita Mon) and the address of the entire Imperial Palace is Chiyoda, Chiyoda Ward.
Address: 1-1 Chiyoda, Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo Metropolis (in the Imperial Palace, north of Sakashita Mon) and the address of the entire Imperial Palace is Chiyoda, Chiyoda Ward.
Address: 1-1 Chiyoda, Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo Metropolis (in the Imperial Palace, north of Sakashita Mon) and the address of the entire Imperial Palace is Chiyoda, Chiyoda Ward.

sen.j: 宮内庁内郵便局：大正13年9月に開局する。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency Post office: started its business in September in 1924.
The Imperial Household Agency Post office: started its business in September in 1924.
The Imperial Household Agency Post office: started its business in September in 1924.

sen.j: 現在は郵便局株式会社が設置する郵便局。
sen.e: Today, it is an post office run by Japan Post Network Company.
Today, it is an post office run by Japan Post Network Company.
Today, it is an post office run by Japan Post Network Company.

sen.j: 宮内庁職員など関係者のみ利用可能。
sen.e: This post office can be used only by persons such as staff of the Imperial Household Agency.
This post office can be used only by persons such as staff of the Imperial Household Agency.
This post office can be used only by persons such as staff of the Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 食堂：宮内庁職員・関係者・記者クラブ関係者が利用できる普通の職員食堂であるが、ここには御料牧場で生産された牛乳の自動販売機が設置されており、食堂を利用できる者であれば誰でも購入できる。
sen.e: Restaurant: it is an ordinary staff's dining room that staff of the Imperial Household Agency, persons concerned, press club members can use, and in this room, there is an vending machine to sell milk produced in Goryo Farm (farm of imperial property) and anyone who can use the dinning room can buy it.

Restaurant: it is an ordinary staff's dining room that staff of the Imperial Household Agency, persons concerned, press club members can use, and in this room, there is an vending machine to sell milk produced in Goryo Farm (farm of imperial property) and anyone who can use the dinning room can buy it.

Restaurant: it is an ordinary staff's dining room that staff of the Imperial Household Agency, persons concerned, press club members can use, and in this room, there is an vending machine to sell milk produced in Goryo Farm (farm of imperial property) and anyone who can use the dinning room can buy it.

sen.j: 瓶牛乳1本60円。
sen.e: A bottle of milk costs 60 yen.
A bottle of milk costs 60 yen.
A bottle of milk costs 60 yen.

sen.j: 内部部局（長官官房、3職、2部）、2施設等機関、1地方支分部局を設置する。
sen.e: The agency has internal subdivisions (Grand Steward's Secretariat, three shiki, two departments), two agencies and facilities, one office for Local Branch Bureaus and Departments.
The agency has internal subdivisions (Grand Steward's Secretariat, three offices, two departments), two agencies and facilities, one office for Local Branch Bureaus and Departments.
sen.cmt: 上記の文章と揃うように、shiki を offices に変えました。
sen.e: The agency has internal subdivisions (Grand Steward's Secretariat, three offices, two departments), two agencies and facilities, one office for Local Branch Bureaus and Departments.

sen.j: 宮内庁長官と侍従長（侍従職の長）は認証官。
sen.e: The Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency and the Grand Chamberlain (the head of the Board of Chamberlains) are officers certified by the Emperor.
The Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency and the Grand Chamberlain (the head of the Board of Chamberlains) are officers certified by the Emperor.
The Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency and the Grand Chamberlain (the head of the Board of Chamberlains) are officers certified by the Emperor.

sen.j: 侍従職と東宮職はそれぞれ天皇一家、皇太子一家の側近奉仕という特質上、皇位継承があった場合、東宮職の職員は即位した天皇皇后について侍従職に移り、逆にもとにいた侍従職のほとんどの職員が、大行天皇の皇后であった皇太后の側近奉仕をする皇太后宮職に移るか、新皇太子の側近奉仕をする東宮職に移る。
sen.e: The Board of Chamberlains and Togu-shiki (the Board of the Crown Prince's Affairs) serve specifically as aides for Emperor family and the Crown Prince family respectively, so if the Crown Prince succeeds to the throne, all Togu-shiki move to the Board of Chamberlains with the new Emperor and Empress and most of the former Board of Chamberlains staff move either to serve for the Empress Dowager who was the Empress of Taiko-Tenno (the departed emperor) or to become Togu-shiki to serve new Crown Prince.

The Board of Chamberlains and Togu-shiki (the Board of the Crown Prince's Affairs) serve specifically as aides for Emperor family and the Crown Prince family respectively, so if the Crown Prince succeeds to the throne, all Togu-shiki move to the Board of Chamberlains with the new Emperor and Empress and most of the former Board of Chamberlains staff move either to serve for the Empress Dowager who was the Empress of Taiko-Tenno (the departed emperor) or to become Togu-shiki to serve new Crown Prince.

The Board of Chamberlains and Togu-shiki (the Board of the Crown Prince's Affairs) serve specifically as aides for Emperor family and the Crown Prince family respectively, so if the Crown Prince succeeds to the throne, all Togu-shiki move to the Board of Chamberlains with the new Emperor and Empress and most of the former Board of Chamberlains staff move either to serve for the Empress Dowager who was the Empress of Taiko-Tenno (the departed emperor) or to become Togu-shiki to serve new Crown Prince.

sen.j: 宮中祭祀を担当する掌典職は、「内廷」の職員であって、宮内庁や国の機関の職員（国家公務員）ではない。
sen.e: The ceremonial staff who is responsible for court rituals is the staff of the "inner court" and not the staff of the Imperial Household Agency or national agencies (national public officer).
The ceremonial staff who is responsible for court rituals is the staff of the "inner court" and not the staff of the Imperial Household Agency or national agencies (national public officer).
The ceremonial staff who is responsible for court rituals is the staff of the "inner court" and not the staff of the Imperial Household Agency or national agencies (national public officer).

sen.j: 詳細は当該項目を参照。
sen.e: See appropriate items for details.

sen.j: - 正倉院宝物の保存管理を行う。

Imperial Household Agency Kyoto Office - (Kyoto Prefecture)

sen.j: - 国有財産である京都御所、仙洞御所、桂離宮、修学院離宮と桃山陵墓監区、月輪陵墓監区、畝傍陵墓監区、古市陵墓監区の各所轄の近畿地方の天皇陵や皇族の墓を管理する。
sen.e: - This agency administers national properties such as Kyoto Imperial Palace, Sento Imperial Palace, Katsura Imperial Villa, Shugakuin Imperial Villa and the Imperial mausoleums and tombs of Imperial families in the Kinki region under the supervision of the Momoyama Mausoleum Region, Tsukinowa Mausoleum Region, Unebi Mausoleum Region, and Furuichi Mausoleum Region.

- This agency administers national properties such as Kyoto Imperial Palace, Sento Imperial Palace, Katsura Imperial Villa, Shugakuin Imperial Villa and the Imperial mausoleums and tombs of Imperial families in the Kinki region under the supervision of the Momoyama Mausoleum Region, Tsukinowa Mausoleum Region, Unebi Mausoleum Region, and Furuichi Mausoleum Region.

- This agency administers national properties such as Kyoto Imperial Palace, Sento Imperial Palace, Katsura Imperial Villa, Shugakuin Imperial Villa and the Imperial mausoleums and tombs of Imperial families in the Kinki region under the supervision of the Momoyama Mausoleum Region, Tsukinowa Mausoleum Region, Unebi Mausoleum Region, and Furuichi Mausoleum Region.

sen.j: 1947年の宮内府設置、1949年の宮内庁改称と日本国憲法の施行以来一貫して長官の職は認証官であり、その任免は天皇により認証される。
sen.e: The post of Grand Steward has been officers certified by the Emperor since the establishment of Kunaifu in 1947 and the name change to Imperial Household Agency and the effectuation of the Constitution of Japan in 1949, and its appointment and dismissal are attest by the Emperor.

The post of Grand Steward has been officers certified by the Emperor since the establishment of Kunaifu in 1947 and the name change to Imperial Household Agency and the effectuation of the Constitution of Japan in 1949, and its appointment and dismissal are attest by the Emperor.

The post of Grand Steward has been officers certified by the Emperor since the establishment of Kunaifu in 1947 and the name change to Imperial Household Agency and the effectuation of the Constitution of Japan in 1949, and its appointment and dismissal are attest by the Emperor.

sen.j: 尚、近年では旧内務省 (日本)系官庁の事務次官あるいはそれに準ずるポスト（警視総監）の経験者が就任するのが慣例となっている。
sen.e: In recent year, it has become an institution that the deputy secretary such as former Ministry of Interior or one who experienced an equal post (the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner) takes up the grand steward position.

In recent year, it has become an institution that the deputy secretary such as former Ministry of Interior or one who experienced an equal post (the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner) takes up the grand steward position.

In recent year, it has become an institution that the deputy secretary such as former Ministry of Interior or one who experienced an equal post (the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner) takes up the grand steward position.

tit.e: Successive Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency
Successive Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency
Successive Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency

sen.j: 2001年1月6日の中央省庁再編施行とともに叙級制度は廃止
sen.e: Investiture system was abolished when the central government ministries and agencies were reorganized in January 6, 2001.
sen.cmt: 叙級制度の適訳が見つかりません。investiture system としておきます。
sen.e: Investiture system was abolished when the central government ministries and agencies were reorganized in January 6, 2001.

tit.e: Successive deputy director of Imperial Household Agency

sen.j: 1950年6月1日以降、叙級なし
sen.e: Since June 1st, 1950, no investiture was given.
